definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to be in a position of power

sentences.english: He said he is less thrilled that Mr. Killinger remains in command.
sentences.chinese: 他表示，对基林格继续执掌大权的并不感到激动。

sentences.english: He who has great power should use it lightly.
sentences.chinese: 不可滥权，掌大权者令不轻发。

sentences.english: The president's stranglehold on power has given the Central African country a certain stability.
sentences.chinese: 他紧抓总统大权使这个中非国家相当稳定。

sentences.english: Once in power, they are ruthless in suppressing the rights of others.
sentences.chinese: 一旦其大权在握，就会无情践踏他人的权利。

sentences.english: The man in high position has power of life and death over many people.
sentences.chinese: 这位身居高职的人物手握对众多人口的生杀予夺大权。

sentences.english: The king is sheard of his power by his nobles.
sentences.chinese: 国王的大权被他的贵族们剥夺殆尽。

sentences.english: We have the fucking power to kill, that's why they fear us.
sentences.chinese: 我们有生杀予夺的大权，使得他们畏惧。

sentences.english: These and other checks and balances ensure that no single branch of government exercises too much power.
sentences.chinese: 这种制衡关系使政府的任何一个部门都无法独揽大权。

sentences.english: He stressed he had the power of life and death over the hostages in the building.
sentences.chinese: 他强调他对大楼内的人质有生杀大权。

sentences.english: To quote Spider - Man's late uncle : "With great power comes great responsibility."
sentences.chinese: 正如蜘蛛侠的最新名言“揽大权者担重任。”

sentences.english: During Sun Tzu’s time, the Emperor was the chief ruler.
sentences.chinese: 在孙子的时代，皇帝独揽大权。

sentences.english: They hold the power of life and death over millions.
sentences.chinese: 他们掌握着数百万人的生杀大权。

sentences.english: People are charging the Labour government with bossiness.
sentences.chinese: 民众谴责工党政府试图大权独揽。

sentences.english: The skill of the disease could save lives, book in hand.
sentences.chinese: 得这种病的人能否保住性命，生杀大权在阎王爷手中。

sentences.english: Otherwise, he might as well move out of the White House, and hand the keys over to the Tea Party.
sentences.chinese: 不然，他还不如从白宫搬出去，将大权交给茶会党。

sentences.english: Power is at hand, the sun?

definition: to be in a position of power
to wield (political etc) power/be in power
property ownership or right/financial power/financial control
in charge (of a position etc)/the person in charge/responsible
